intro: Pityrodia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, often white or pinkish flowers. They typically grow in coastal or sandy soils and are adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Pityrodia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native habitats.
